questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.correctAnswer: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.
wrongAnswers: CSS stands for Cascading Script Syntax.
CSS stands for Computer Style Sheets.
CSS stands for Common Style Sheets.

questions.question: What is the purpose of CSS?
questions.correctAnswer: CSS is used to style and layout web pages.
wrongAnswers: CSS is used to create dynamic web content.
CSS is used to define HTML structure.
CSS is used to link external resources.

questions.question: How do you apply CSS to an HTML document?
questions.correctAnswer: CSS can be applied via inline styles, internal styles, or external stylesheets.
wrongAnswers: CSS can only be applied using inline styles.
CSS is applied by directly editing the HTML content.
CSS is applied through JavaScript only.

questions.question: What is a CSS selector?
questions.correctAnswer: A CSS selector targets HTML elements to apply styles.
wrongAnswers: A CSS selector is a function in JavaScript.
A CSS selector is used to group HTML elements together.
A CSS selector targets a CSS property.

questions.question: What does the 'color' property do in CSS?
questions.correctAnswer: The 'color' property sets the text color.
wrongAnswers: The 'color' property sets the background color.
The 'color' property defines the font size.
The 'color' property specifies the border color.

questions.question: What does the 'background-color' property do?
questions.correctAnswer: It sets the background color of an element.
wrongAnswers: It defines the font color of an element.
It sets the color of the text inside the element.
It applies a shadow effect to an element.

questions.question: What is the 'font-size' property used for?
questions.correctAnswer: It defines the size of the text.
wrongAnswers: It defines the font family used in the text.
It controls the alignment of the text.
It specifies the color of the text.

questions.question: What does the 'margin' property do?
questions.correctAnswer: It sets space around an element's outside.
wrongAnswers: It sets the space inside an element's content.
It defines the height of an element.
It sets the font size of the text inside an element.

questions.question: What is the 'padding' property used for?
questions.correctAnswer: It sets space inside an element, between its content and border.
wrongAnswers: It defines space outside an element.
It sets the border style of an element.
It adjusts the font size inside an element.

questions.question: What is the difference between 'class' and 'id' selectors?
questions.correctAnswer: 'class' is used for multiple elements, while 'id' is unique to one element.
wrongAnswers: 'class' is used only for layout, 'id' is used for styling.
'class' is used for text styling, 'id' for background color.
'class' is for internal elements, 'id' is for external elements.

questions.question: What does the 'display' property do?
questions.correctAnswer: It defines how an element is displayed (e.g., block, inline).
wrongAnswers: It sets the height of an element.
It adjusts the background color of an element.
It defines the visibility of an element.

questions.question: What is the 'position' property used for?
questions.correctAnswer: It controls the positioning of an element (e.g., static, relative, absolute).
wrongAnswers: It sets the width of an element.
It defines the background color of an element.
It controls the opacity of an element.

questions.question: What is the 'float' property in CSS?
questions.correctAnswer: It allows an element to be floated to the left or right.
wrongAnswers: It specifies the font size of an element.
It adjusts the margin of an element.
It defines the text color of an element.

questions.question: What does the 'z-index' property do?
questions.correctAnswer: It sets the stacking order of elements (higher value means higher stacking).
wrongAnswers: It defines the width of an element.
It sets the background transparency of an element.
It controls the animation speed of an element.
